post_message: Was really disappointed with your Port Talbot store yesterday  we had ordered a number of rolls from the bakery for a 9am collection as my mother and I were providing a buffet after my Aunties funeral. When we went to collect them they said they didn t know about the order and then changed to say they had a problem and they were being proven and would be ready in an hour and a half . We expressed that we were not happy but would return in an hour and a half. We then went to complain to customer services who said they would check what the problem was and would phone me to confirm the problem. My husband returned at the specified time to be told there was no order in the book  then they found it  and was then told they hadn t put them in the oven yet!!!! Confused??? Me too  it seems there was a catalogue of errors in the store yesterday as we had no phonecall from customer services either! We finally had our rolls which we had to then cool under fans in order to use them . Yesterday was already a stressful day without all this. I don t usually complain but I was really upset. I would like to add though in general I love shopping in your store  the staff are always friendly and helpful. Thanks

post_message: Just a heads up Tesco  you ve got this so wrong here s what Scots are doing  This is what I have done: Instead of simply whinging online about this  on Thursday I will be doing a big shop at Aldi/Lidl instead of my usual Tesco. post_message: I have been in email communications with your Customer Services team for the past week regarding your proud press announcement to start selling Carolina Reaper Chillies.  It seems as though they are as attainable as a unicorn steak and not only that  your customer services team in fact know nothing about them.  This issue first arose after making a special effort to try and locate them in the London stores listed as stockists on your website.  None of the stores had them in stock which is why I contacted Customer Services.  The first person told me to check in the stores listed on your website (which was a point I had made clear in my first email) and then told me that there are supplier issues and they don t know when they ll be back in stock after telling me they are not in stock.  Another person apologised for the  rigmarole  and said that the confusion has arisen from the fact that Carolina Chillies go by another name and that they are the Komodo Dragon chillies and widely available.  I was stunned  especially given that the recent press release not only includes a graphic showing that Carolina is hotter than Komodo but that you started selling Komodo chillies in 2015 and that of course they are two entirely different chillies - I am still waiting for a response from Customer Services regarding this.  Your press announcement remains online as do the fanciful stockists and I really would like to know if  when and where in the country they will be available?

post_message: So took 2 iPhones to Apple this morning  bought around the same time 23 months ago.both  with the same fault. The one bought from Apple was replaced with a brand new phone within 90 minutes. However the other bought from Tesco is a very different matter. They have offered to send it away for 10  days for an attempt at repair before a possible replacement with a reconditioned model if unable to do so. Obviously this is a complete waste of their time and effort as I will not be without a phone for 10 days so am off to  guess where .....to buy a replacement. Yes  Apple of course.  Moral . post_message: Receiving the most appalling service and worst customer experience of my life by Tesco Direct. Is it possible that a company like Tesco deals with delivery companies like Arrow XL which are unable to give correct information and  not only that  but also tell lies? I have been waiting for the delivery of my wardrobes for over 1 month and a half. Been regularly given the wrong information  been told a date and then delivery not even going out of the depot. Been told that I was contacted when it never happened (by Arrow). Dealing now with 2 managers at Tesco customer service team: David Petrey and Lorraine Craig  still not getting anywhere. This matter need to be dealt at higher level as this is not the service any decent company gives to customers. I need my wardrobes ASAP  I want to file a formal complaint but nobody is listening  so turning to Facebook   I need somebody to listen and take the matter in hands!

post_message: Dear Tesco   So it is now 6 weeks since we first reported that a pubic hair was found in one of your “Tesco Low Fat Berry Medley Yoghurts”.  We first reported the incident in store on the 2nd July and then having heard nothing from your customer service team (I asked for the incident to be investigated and then a letter from Tesco explaining the reason for the genital pube in the yoghurt) I raised this via Facebook.  As you can imagine we got an instant response  excellent I thought  we are getting somewhere.    The issue was reported via Facebook on the 27th July.  It is now the 14th August.  We have been away on holiday during that time and still no letter from Tesco when we got home.  A big disappointment.  Perhaps I was wrong and pubic hair is a key ingredient in your Tesco Low Fat Berry Medley Yoghurts  if so would you please be kind enough to highlight this on the packaging so that the customer does not get a surprise when they find the pube located within the half eaten pot.  Happy if pubes are part of the manufacturing process  but as I said please can you make this clear on the packaging in the future so that we can avoid having to purchase any products that contain them.  It would be nice if somebody at Tesco could take this seriously as it is a major failure of your GMP processes to allow genital hairs into your products.  A hair from somebody’s head or face you can understand if something finds its way in a product by mistake  but not a genital hair.  Seriously though customer service should be your number one priority  without customers you are not able to function correctly.  One customer has a bad experience they tell 10 people  if they have a good one  they may tell one.  Basic customer service is not hard and an organisation like Tesco should have it down to a fine art.  Perhaps you have just got too big and you no longer care about the people who buy from your stores and pay for your wages.  Once again I look forward to hearing from you (maybe)  an apology would be nice and possibly an explanation about how it happened  how you intend on changing your procedure to hopefully stop it happening again  and also how it has taken you so long to send a letter.    You could have walked and hand delivered a letter by now.  Many thanks.  Kind regards   Paul

post_message: Hi Firstly I would like to say thanks for your free fruit scheme as it really keeps my eldest quiet and happy as we shop  she rushes in to find it when we go! But I d also like to apologise for a) my daughter eating copious amounts of the fruit  and b) for my youngest that often chews a bit and throws it on your floor and whilst I do try my best to pick it all up in sure I miss bits. But more importantly I want to say thanks. Thanks to a young lady working in your Loughborough The Rushes store. A few weeks ago she served me and asked how I was  I explained that my youngest had just had a big operation and so we were all tired but relieved and just adjusting to life whilst she s in a big cast (being treated for hip Dysplasia so the cast is from her chest to both ankles). I left and thought she was kind and friendly but nothing else. However  this week whilst shopping again she happened to be serving us but I didn t even realise until she said  oh hi how lovely you ve brought your little one today how s she getting on with everything ? I was speechless. Instead of the usual stares and funny looks at her cast someone I didn t know was asking how she was! And she d remembered her and us as a family. I was really touched and it made me smile for the rest of the day. So thank you I have spoken to customer services at The Rushes store but I would equally appreciate you saying thank you/well done to the lady. I am determined to find her name and thank her personally too as I was so touched by her thoughtful comments at the time I completely forgot to check her name and say thank you. As you say  every little helps! And it really does x

post_message: Great service this morning Tesco  not quite perfect but you ve got some great people working for you.  I booked a delivery for this morning but didn t check out in time and lost the slot. When I booked another slot I forgot to amend the address before I checked out so I got a call from the delivery driver at 7.30 this morning asking where I was. Once we d established he was outside my old house he gave me the number of customer services to call to try and sort. I spoke to a lovely lady in customer services and she pleaded with your Crawley delivery centre to deliver to my new address (sadly they wouldn t  that is my only issue with today s service though). Anyway  she was lovely  she deleted my old address from my account so it didn t happen again. Anyway  a bit later on the delivery driver calls me back. He says he was just checking in on me  he said he d seen baby formula in my delivery and had I been able to sort a delivery for today and did I need the formula? I d already rebooked my delivery for tomorrow so was sorted but he didn t have to do that  he didn t have to make sure I was ok. He was lovely. I d like to thank him again  and you should certainly be pleased you have caring staff such as him  and also lovely people like the customer services lady that commiserated with me at 7.30 this morning! Unfortunately I didn t catch either of their names.

post_message: My village store is Tesco Express  Belton  Norfolk.  During the week  the regular staff are brilliant  the store is welcoming and customer service is excellent. At weekends it is a totally different story.  The weekend staff have no concept of customer service. This morning - and this is normal for a Saturday - the newspapers were in a complete shambles. I could not find The Times  then realised another gentleman was also looking for one. We eventually found them  under a pile of Daily Mails! We then realised there were no magazines in the paper. We discovered them in a pile  nowhere near The Times. How many people got home to find their paper incomplete I wonder.  I told the girl on the till the papers were in a mess  to which she replied  they didn t arrive in the right order . What on earth does that mean?  To add insult to injury the lottery machine is out of action for the second weekend in as many weeks. The reason  It has run out of paper and we are waiting for it to come in.  Unbelievable.  The store is so bad at weekends  I regularly phone Tesco Customer Service who assure me they take up complaints with the management. But nothing ever happens. What a shambles!

post_message: I think you need to sort out your arrangement with hermes. Ordering school clothes online was easy but delivery was terrible. Most of my order was missing. Tesco rearranged items to be sent ASAP (thank you tesco) Missing items were then received with extra trousers that I d already received (rang back to be told that I could keep them for inconvenience caused by the screw up) kept receiving 2 items I hadn t ordered for me to realise yesterday after receiving a delivery it was because they shared the same order number with the item I ordered.  Again rang back to explain why you kept sending me wrong items and what could I do with them (told me to take back to store for refund). Got woken up this morning by a delivery driver with original missing items. Rang tesco yet again as you was waiting for jumpers to come back into stock to send to me and these came this morning. Spoke to a rude person who told me under no certain terms I had to return all duplicate items to a tesco store ASAP other wise you would charge me for the extra you sent including the trousers I had been told I could keep. I ordered online as it was an easier option with 3 young kids (one with severe learning and behaviour disabilities) it s not my fault that hermes screwed up my order. It would of been easier for me to take all 3 kids in store to buy the clothes in the first place and put up with my son s meltdowns in store as I now have to go there anyway with them but this time they will have to wait patiently (not going to happen) in a line at customer services and then wait quietly (really not going to happen) for me to explain this whole mess to the staff at customers service ............  Thanks for the hassle guys
